DataElement.preferredName: Patient Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol for questions related to the administration of live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received administ
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received administration of a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or it is anticipated that a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had administration of a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or has had anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received administration of a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received administration of a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or it is anticipated that a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received administration of a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before randomization or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live, attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to the first dose of investigational treatment or within 30 days of the last dose of study drug(s)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live vaccine within 30 days of planned study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live attenuated vaccination within 6 months prior to study entry or within 30 days of receiving MEDI4736 (durvalumab) and tremelimumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with a live, attenuated vaccine within 30 days of the first dose of peposertib (M3814)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received administration of a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before study registration or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received administration of a live or live attenuated vaccine within 6 weeks of initiation of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree not to receive live, attenuated influenza vaccine (e.g., FluMist®) within 4 weeks prior to study entry, during treatment or within 5 months following the last dose of atezolizumab/placebo?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or it is anticipated that a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient agree not to receive live, attenuated vaccines (e.g., FluMist) while receiving study treatment and after the last dose until B-cell recovery to the normal ranges?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient undergoing vaccination with live vaccines and live attenuated vaccines in the 30 days prior to receiving TAK-243, during the study, and for 100 days after the last dose of study drug?
